channel.title: Breakouts
channel.description:
We all have problems with acne/breakouts at least one point in our lives, so don't act like it's a bad thing
I have little pimples on my forehead, not exactly zits.
The more I use cleaners on them, the more they seem to breakout and get even more red
Any suggestions on getting rid of them quicker? I use pads to scrub my face in the morning and at night. Twice a day.

item.title: Breakouts
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

The medication I use to be taking before they put me on another was Sertaline, I couldn’t tell if it was because of the medication or because of something else. Nonetheless, I would imagine that it did worked because now I’m having a little break out which I will be able to take care of soon.

But I don’t think that information is going to work because your probably not on an Anti-Depressant so just go to the doctor and have the either see if they can work on it, or have them admit you to a dermatologist.

Read full topic

item.title: Breakouts
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Swim in pools a lot.

Read full topic

get this thing, its what I use http://www.cleanandclear.com/product/cleansers/clean-clear-morning-burst-surge

item.title: Breakouts
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Mack n cheese, post:3, topic:400675”][quote author=`SJ_ link=topic=497734.msg3639868#msg3639868 date=1308880851]
Put some tooth paste on them.
[/quote]Something tells me your just trying to get me to do that, than laugh when I say it doesn’t work. :P[/quote]

Actually, put toothpaste on them before bed, they dry them out. Or use some peroxide.

Read full topic

item.title: Breakouts
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

It will always get worse before it gets better. Just keep with it.

Read full topic
